br.com.eits.m4j.bean

Class MkCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.eits.m4j.bean.MkCommand

  • public class MkCommand
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that encapsulates a command to be sent to the router, it
    is possible to send a command with parameters more easily by using
    the aiding methods
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 23/07/2012
    Author:
    Arthur Gregorio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MkCommand(java.lang.String baseCommand)
      The base command to send for the router For example: To retrieve the ip address list send: /ip/address/print as base command if you want to put any parameter in this command, use the appendParameter(String, String) method

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendParameter(java.lang.String parameter, java.lang.String value)
      Append a new parameter in the command string
      java.lang.String asCommandString()
      Concatenates the parameters of a command string to be sent to the router

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MkCommand

        public MkCommand(java.lang.String baseCommand)
        The base command to send for the router For example: To retrieve the ip address list send: /ip/address/print as base command if you want to put any parameter in this command, use the appendParameter(String, String) method
        Parameters:
        baseCommand - the base command to concatenates with the parameters

    • Method Detail

      • appendParameter

        public void appendParameter(java.lang.String parameter,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Append a new parameter in the command string
        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter
        value - the parameter value

      • asCommandString

        public java.lang.String asCommandString()
        Concatenates the parameters of a command string to be sent to the router
        Returns:
        the command string
